subject: Brake Pedal Issue
description_text:
Hi,

Yesterday I was racing using the Pro X Ultra pedal set, when suddenly my
brake remained engaged even though I had taken my foot off. I have been
testing and there are 2 issues I've found:
- There is a sudden jump from +/- 60% to 100% registered in the Simsonn
software, even though I am only gradually pressing the pedal. This issue
happens in perhaps 9 out of 10 times of pressing the pedal, the remaining 1
out of 10 times the registration does go up gradually as expected. I am
using the linear curve type.
- Frequently after releasing the pedal the Simsonn software is still
registering anywhere between 15% - 100% engagement. I can't find a pattern
in when this happens, it just seems random. This happens perhaps 3 out of
10 times of pressing the pedal and I've seen mostly 15%, 30% and 100%
registration remaining. Pressing the pedal again and releasing tends to
resolve it momentarily, though usually it takes a couple of pressings for
it to go away.

Steps I've tried:
- Recalibrate the pedals
- Offset, then disconnect the device, then recalibrate
- The process I was advised by you previously in the screenshot:
[image: image.png]
Since that didn't help either, I did another recalibration, which also did
not fix the issue(s).

Some additional info that I think is relevant:
- I have been using the pedals for almost half a year without any issue and
have not made changes to the setup or the cabling in the past few months.
- I have performed the above steps both before and after updating the
Simsonn software to the latest version.

Could you please advise on what the next steps are?

Best regards,

Dirk Deckers

conversations.body_text: Hello,     Just wanted to add that I now noticed that my VAM Pro motors have also stopped working. In the Simsonn software they show as disconnected, while in Simhub they still show as connected, but when I test the effects, nothing happens / triggers. I don't know if these issues are connected.     Best regards,     Dirk

Hi Dirk Deckers,     Please first update the firmware using Simsonn Manager 2.1.3 and confirm that the versions are CPU1: 2.0.6 and CPU2: 2.0.4, then check whether the issue is resolved. Additionally, please send me a clear photo of the side of your brake pedal so I can check it. Please also provide your order number for further verification.        Please uninstall the old version of the software from your computer, then download and install the latest Simsonn Manager 2.1.2. Next, follow the steps below to start the firmware update process:    Press the Upgrade button on the control box;    Reconnect the USB cable;    The software will prompt that it has entered “Simsonn Flasher Mode”;    Go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals → firmware → pedals-proxultra.sfu to start the update;    Once the firmware update is complete, release the Upgrade button;    Finally, test and recalibrate the pedals.

Hi,

Thank you for the response. Just to clarify and make sure I use the right
version: first you write to use Simsonn Manager 2.1.3, but int he next
paragraph it says 2.1.2. I find both versions on your website. Which one
should I use? I'll continue with the above steps once you confirm.

Thank you,
Br,

Dirk

Hello,

Noticing that it had 2.0.5 for CPU1 (instead of 2.0.6 as you wrote), I

With this out of the way, I went through the steps you wrote out. This has
fixed the VAM Pro motors issue, they are now working. The brake pedal issue

multiple, because it's pretty hard to get a clear shot of the whole thing,
as well I wasn't sure if it needed to be a particular side, left or right.
Should they not contain the detail(s) you're looking for, then please let
me know which part to focus on and I can take another photo.

Best regards,

Dirk

Hi Dirk Deckers,     Please check whether the limit screw is adjusted too low, which could prevent the pedal from moving downward properly during pressing, resulting in incorrect or missing output data.  You can follow these steps to troubleshoot:    Remove the pedal from the mounting bracket;    Inspect the central screw post of the pedal sensor;    Adjust the screw to raise the limit screw slightly;    Reinstall the pedal onto the bracket;    Connect the pedal to the controller box and replug the USB once;    Open the software and click the Offset button;    Recalibrate the pedal and check whether the output is normal.    If the issue still persists after these steps, it is likely that the brake pressure sensor is damaged, and we can send you a replacement pressure sensor.

Hello,

Could you please elaborate on which piece is which? I'm not sure which one
would be the central screw post and which is the limit screw. I'm also
unclear on how the limit screw would be slightly raised. Do I tighten it?
Or release it, move it manually and then retighten?

Br,

Dirk

[image: image.png]


On Sun, 11 Jan 2026 at 03:18, service@simsonn.com

Hi Dirk Deckers,     Please adjust this hole at the bottom of the brake pedal. As it is currently the weekend, I do not have a high-resolution reference image available at the moment. Thank you for your understanding.

Hi,

The image was very helpful, thank you. I found the screw, tightened it by
75% of 1 full turn and went through the rest of the steps. It looks like
the issue is resolved with this. Thanks again, I'm very happy :) I
appreciate the help on the weekend all the more.

FYI, the registration is showing higher numbers than before. For the same
pressure I applied before, it's now showing me +/- 80 kg of pressure,
instead of the 60 kg. I imagine that's what the limit screw influences and
to me it doesn't matter, since I have it set up to feel the same regardless
of what number it shows now. Just figured I'd mention it, in case it is
useful for you to know.

Best regards,

Dirk
